Class List

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--List
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterator, java.io.Serializable
public class List
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, Iterator

A standard List class. Simply Extend to specialise it for your purpose. Can only be used with Listable Objects.

See Also:
Listable, Serialized Form

List

public List(Listable[] theObjects)
     throws ListFullException
Creates a List from an existing array of Listables. Assumes that the Array is full of data members and copies it exactly.
Parameters:
Listable[] - The array of Listables to convert to a List
Throws:
ListFullException - Only occures if there is an Internal error

             throws ListFullException
Adds a listable Object to to the List.

Throws:
ListFullException - if the List is already full.

getItem

public Listable getItem(Listable other)
                 throws ListItemInvalidException,
                        ListEmptyException
Returns a link to a Listable Object in the List by comparing the given Listable to all the Listables in the List using the isEqual method.
Parameters:
other - The give Listable to compare to
Returns:
The Listable which matches the given Listable
Throws:
ListEmptyException - If the List is empty
ListItemInvalidException - If the given Listable does not match any in the List.

getItemIndex

public int getItemIndex(Listable other)
                 throws ListItemInvalidException,
                        ListEmptyException
Returns the index value of a Listable Object in the List by comparing the given Listable to all the Listables in the List using the isEqual method.
Parameters:
other - The give Listable to compare to
Returns:
The index of the Listable which matches the given Listable
Throws:
ListEmptyException - If the List is empty
ListItemInvalidException - If the given Listable does not match any in the List.

getItemAt

public Listable getItemAt(int x)
                   throws ListEmptyException,
                          IndexInvalidException
Returns the Item at the given index value
Parameters:
x - The Index value of the Item
Returns:
The item at the given index#
Throws:
ListEmptyException - If the List is empty
IndexInvalidException - if the index does not point to an item

removeItem

public Listable removeItem(Listable other)
                    throws ListItemInvalidException,
                           ListEmptyException,
                           IndexInvalidException
Removes an item from the List and returns a link to it. Uses the getItemIndex() method to find the Objects index and then the < CODE>removeItemAt() method to remove it (hence the IndexInvalidException). If you no longer need the removed item, simply discard it.
Parameters:
other - The object to compare to using the isEqual method.
Returns:
The object which was removed.
Throws:
ListItemInvalidException - If the given Listable does not match any in the List.
ListEmptyException - If the List is empty.
IndexInvalidException - This could only happen with an internal error.

removeItemAt

public Listable removeItemAt(int theIndex)
                      throws ListEmptyException,
                             IndexInvalidException
Removes the Item At the give Index and replaces it with the Object at the end of the List (Keeps all the Objects at the front of the array).
Parameters:
int - theIndex The Index of the Item to remove
Returns:
Listable a Handle of the Object which was removed.
Throws:
ListEmptyException - If the List Is empty.
IndexInvalidException - If the Index does not point to an Object in the List.
